doc.source_uri: 2025-08-31/Kuaishou Technology Investor Day Takeaways AI in FocusKuaishou Technology Investor Day Takeaways AI in Focus_2025-08-31

passages.text: August 31, 2025 11:53 PM GMT
Kuaishou Technology | Asia Pacific
Core business continues to see stable growth. Kling keeps fast iteration and AI is empowering Kuaishou's core ad/ecommerce as well.

Kling's revenue has been running at \(>Rmb100mn/month\) since April 2025 (Kling 2.0 launch). Its grossing has jumped whenever new models/features were released. The recently launched opening- and- closing- frame feature (Aug 25) was an industry first and users were keen to adopted it, per management.

This suggests model capability is still the key area to differentiate, and will continue to be the focus for Kuaishou's investment. In addition, Kuaishou is working on workflow integration and end- to- end solutions to improve user stickiness. Such patterns also suggest low prices are not effective in attracting users due to the model performance gap and heavy infra investment. Having said that, Kuaishou is likely to be more aggressive in future on both model iteration and pricing to win customers.

There are lot of new entrants in the AI video generation area and, overall, technology is far from mature. Model and product imagination capabilities are Kuaishou's competitive advantage, according to management. Kling is well recognized by its video quality in terms of reality, consistency and movement. In the longer term, videos' personalization will be a key area to improve. Kling wants its users to act as a director and have a virtual studio when using its product.
A closed- source language model provides limited upside to video generation system's performance.

TAM: Mgmt sees annual US \(14bn\) video production market globally and expects AI to be able to address 20- 30% of the market (AI product needs to share benefit with creators). In the long run, AI video generation could make up 50% of the market.
Overseas users contribute 70% of Kling's revenue. Kling still has room to improve in terms of local operation (it only offers English version overseas) and B2B sales coverage.

Historically, Kuaishou was a first mover in several initiatives, but its peers became more successful. Management believes this was due to its different customer segmentation (Kuaishou stayed in low- tiered cities). Kling AI's user base (creator community, overseas) is quite different from short videos.
Kling's fast development was the key reason for the capex guidance raise from Rmb10bn to Rmb12bn (doubling capex for Kling).
(Continued in following page.)

Morgan Stanley does and seeks to do business with companies covered in Morgan Stanley Research. As a result, investors should be aware that the firm may have a conflict of interest that could affect the objectivity of Morgan Stanley Research. Investors should consider Morgan Stanley Research as only a single factor in making their investment decision.
For analyst certification and other important disclosures, refer to the Disclosure Section, located at the end of this report.

\(+ =\) Analysts employed by non- U.S. affiliates are not registered with FINRA, may not be associated persons of the member and may not be subject to FINRA restrictions on communications with a subject company, public appearances and trading securities held by a research analyst account.

- Kuaishou launched its new generation AI-based end-to-end recommendation model OneRec in 1H25 and currently 25% of traffic is running on this new system. Mgmt observed: 1) a 1% improvement in total time spent; 2) 5% click through rate improvement in local services search and 4.5% GMV improvement in e-commerce search; 3) When using AI to understand ad content, Kuaishou's internal AB test demonstrated 8ppt improvement in ad recommendations. 4) Customer report ratio fell 20% by linking user behaviors (report, or positive/negative comment) to AI model. 5) Much lower cost for OneRec than previous funnel-based recommendation model.- AI-generated ad content demonstrated similar performance to traditional ads, but can save significant amounts of money for customers. Such ads also brings customers' incremental ads budget to Kuaishou.- Management believes it is relative easy to leverage on AI technology to improve ad recommendations, while it is relatively difficult to simulate other's reactions in the ad bidding system. So it is not urgent to aggressively monetize OneRec.- OneRec is still in iteration stage, and management expect it to take 50-60% of its traffic soon.

- In the short video industry competition, Kuaishou is relatively strong among the younger generation and senior people, particularly in certain categories like agriculture, showground, young stars etc. So the head-to-head competition is not that severe. Kuaishou thinks S&M expense as % of revenue can decline.- Ad business continues to see strong growth from short drama, game, education, local services (though food delivery platforms reduced the ads budget).- E-commerce operation: use the subsidies and commission incentive in a smart way. Shelf-based e-commerce will continue to outgrow. Kuaishou's advantage is the linkage between content and product. In terms of monetization, the take-rate doubled in the past year from a very low base. Management believes its GMV remains small compared with other platforms, it is willing to use some traffic to subsidise merchants. It takes time for the merchants' capabilities to improve. Kuaishou internally wants to bridge the systems for shelf-based e-commerce and live-broadcasting e-commerce ad platforms, which could bring some upside in future.- Commercialization can help content as well. As Kuaishou encourages high-quality ad contents, so in the past 2 years, more ads have not had a negative impact on user experience.- Mgmt sees limited impact on platform from the new tax on ad spending.- Technology improvement is not only about AI, Kuaishou's IDC and bandwidth cost as % revenue continues to fall without any impact to customer experience. It did a lot of optimization on the infra side with internal new resource management platform and new DC cluster in Ulanqab.

Base case, discounted cash flow model - key assumptions include a \(12\%\) WACC and \(2\%\) perpetual growth rate. We also accounted for the valuation of Kling at 25x EV/S, the valuation for top software companies globally.

- Better-than-expected MAU growth.- Improving ad revenue per DAU.- Lower-than-expected sales and marketing expenses, leading to higher margins.- Faster monetization of other revenue, overseas expansion.

- Lower-than-expected advertising revenue growth.- Lower-than-expected margins owing to revenue sharing, S&M and overseas expansion.- Lower-than-expected MAU growth owing to competition, scale-back of S&M.

Morgan Stanley uses a relative rating system using terms such as Overweight, Equal- weight, Not- Rated or Underweight (see definitions below). Morgan Stanley does not assign ratings of Buy, Hold or Sell to the stocks we cover. Overweight, Equal- weight, Not- Rated and Underweight are not the equivalent of buy, hold and sell. Investors should carefully read the definitions of all ratings used in Morgan Stanley Research. In addition, since Morgan Stanley Research contains more complete information concerning the analyst's views, investors should carefully read Morgan Stanley Research, in its entirety, and not infer the contents from the rating alone. In any case, ratings (or research) should not be used or relied upon as investment advice. An investor's decision

The Stock Ratings described below apply to Morgan Stanley's Fundamental Equity Research and do not apply to Debt Research produced by the Firm.

For disclosure purposes only (in accordance with FINRA requirements), we include the category headings of Buy, Hold, and Sell alongside our ratings of Overweight, Equal-weight, Not-Rated and Underweight. Morgan Stanley does not assign ratings of Buy, Hold or Sell to the stocks we cover. Overweight, Equal-weight, Not-Rated and Underweight are not the equivalent of buy,hold, and sell but represent recommended relative weightings (see definitions below). To satisfy regulatory requirements, we correspond Overweight, our most positive stock rating, with a buy recommendation; we correspond Equal-weight and Not-Rated to hold and Underweight to sell recommendations, respectively.

Overweight (O). The stock's total return is expected to exceed the average total return of the analyst's industry (or industry team's) coverage universe, on a risk-adjusted basis, over the next 12-18 months.

Equal-weight (E). The stock's total return is expected to be in line with the average total return of the analyst's industry (or industry team's) coverage universe, on a risk-adjusted basis, over the next 12-18 months.

Not-Rated (NR). Currently the analyst does not have adequate conviction about the stock's total return relative to the average total return of the analyst's industry (or industry team's) coverage universe, on a risk-adjusted basis, over the next 12-18 months.

Underweight (U). The stock's total return is expected to be below the average total return of the analyst's industry (or industry team's) coverage universe, on a risk-adjusted basis, over the next 12-18 months.
Unless otherwise specified, the time frame for price targets included in Morgan Stanley Research is 12 to 18 months.
Attractive (A): The analyst expects the performance of his or her industry coverage universe over the next 12-18 months to be attractive vs. the relevant broad market benchmark, as indicated below.

In-Line (I): The analyst expects the performance of his or her industry coverage universe over the next 12-18 months to be in line with the relevant broad market benchmark, as indicated below.Cautious (C): The analyst views the performance of his or her industry coverage universe over the next 12-18 months with caution vs. the relevant broad market benchmark, as indicated below.

Benchmarks for each region are as follows: North America - S&P 500; Latin America - relevant MSCI country index or MSCI Latin America Index; Europe - MSCI Europe; Japan - TOPIX; Asia -relevant MSCI country index or MSCI sub-regional index or MSCI AC Asia Pacific ex Japan Index.
